snippet: The laying off of the senior film critic at The Voice has some wondering where the newspaper is headed, and where film criticism is headed.
abstract: The laying off of the senior film critic at The Voice has some wondering where the newspaper is headed, and where film criticism is headed.
lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, two long-running trends in journalism came together in a single layoff: Jim Hoberman, a senior film critic at the Village Voice since 1988, was let go, yet another instance of the The Voice taking aim at a veteran - and presumably well paid - employee. He joins a list of longtime Voice writers who have been laid off.

headline.main: Hoberman Is Out at Village Voice, and Curtain Drops on an Era
